Checklist

Welcome to AccessKit!

This tool aims to assist and empower instructors to create digital accessible content through simple step by step instructions.

Each card contains instructions and best practices to make your digital content accessible, click on each of the cards below to learn more about each topic.
If you already have existing content, use the checklist in the top right corner to ensure your content follows accessibility best practices.
Make graphs more accessible by adding alt text and eliminating colours.

Using high quality images and adding alt text will ensure pictures are accessible by all types of users.
By adding alt text all students and screen readers will be able to read and understand your equations.
Including alt text and eliminating colours ensure all students can understand tables.
Choosing the correct fonts, colours, and formatting ensures legibility and readability for all students.
Properly exporting your content ensures that it remains in an accessible format.

Recording your lectures and adding closed captions ensures all students can participate.
Uploading lecture transcripts and slide decks allows all students to learn.
